intro: Thalictrum alpinum, commonly known as Alpine meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and typically grows in rocky or meadow habitats at high elevations. The plant features delicate, fern-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is characterized by its upright stem and is often found in open, sunny environments. Thalictrum alpinum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
